meanings.sent1: My friend is such an extravert, always making new friends wherever she goes.
meanings.sent2: The extravert at the party was the center of attention, chatting with everyone.
meanings.sent3: The extravert decided to throw a party for introverts, just to mix things up.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like an extravert's dream, shining brightly in every social situation.
meanings.sent5: The extravert's energy was contagious, lighting up the room wherever she went.

meanings.definition: To direct one's interest outward or to things outside oneself.
meanings.sent1: I tend to extravert my thoughts by sharing them with others.
meanings.sent2: She liked to extravert her creativity by painting murals in public spaces.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to extravert their curiosity by asking questions.
meanings.sent4: His passion for nature made him extravert his love for the outdoors through photography.
meanings.sent5: The company encouraged employees to extravert their innovative ideas for the new project.
